pr_title: Phoenix-5947 Add tests and extensions to Schema Extraction Tool utility

timeline.message: add unit tests and fixes to the Extraction Tool

timeline.bodyText: This PR does not completely support the multiple column families, especially if there are different properties for each column family as mentioned by Goeffrey on the previous review. Let's modify this if clause to be specific unless you want to include the change in this one and completely get rid of "Not Supported Exception".
timeline.author: swaroopak

timeline.message: support multiple CFs with distinct properties

timeline.bodyText: This should be available in other parts of the code. You can just import here.
timeline.author: swaroopak

timeline.bodyText: Avoid import *
timeline.author: swaroopak

timeline.bodyText: nit: cfMap or cfToPropertyValueMap
timeline.author: swaroopak

timeline.bodyText: space before {
timeline.author: swaroopak

timeline.bodyText: space before { and at other similar spots
timeline.author: swaroopak

timeline.bodyText: let's call it globalValue
timeline.author: swaroopak

timeline.bodyText: nit: cfPropertyValueSet
timeline.author: swaroopak

timeline.bodyText: Let's say there are 3 CFs and only 2 of them have VERSIONS=2. Would this work? Let's add a test if we don't have one to cover this scenario.
timeline.author: swaroopak

replies.bodyText: Yes it's working with only 2 of them having VERSIONS=2. The size of the set will be 2 in this case. I'll add a test to cover this scenario.
replies.author: Qinrui98

timeline.bodyText:
I think we can maintain a map of [propertyValue and occurances] and execute line no. 273 only when exactly one entry from the map has occurrences equal to the no. of column families.
Also, good to refactor this logic in another function.
timeline.author: swaroopak

timeline.bodyText: nit: this if condition is duplicated in the else part. Please refactor it by extracting common parts and executing specific Array related logic when if clause passes.
timeline.author: swaroopak

timeline.bodyText: Thanks for adding this.
timeline.author: swaroopak

timeline.bodyText: nit: remove the commented code
timeline.author: swaroopak

timeline.bodyText: can use assertTrue directly.
timeline.author: swaroopak

timeline.bodyText: nit: could you please remove this variable? It is not used anymore.
timeline.author: swaroopak

timeline.bodyText:
Several of these tests are of the form:

Create a table according to some SQL and table name
Run SchemaExtractionTool
Assert that output is equal to the original SQL.

Can we extract that logic into a helper function and you just pass in different tablename and SQL in each test?
timeline.author: gjacoby126

replies.bodyText: Yes I'll extract the common part into a helper function and avoid duplicated code here.
replies.author: Qinrui98

timeline.bodyText: Good edge case to check!
timeline.author: gjacoby126

timeline.bodyText: nit: comment on what exactly you're checking here would be useful.
timeline.author: gjacoby126

timeline.bodyText: nit: please use a more informative name.
timeline.author: gjacoby126

timeline.bodyText: likewise, please specify what you're trying to show here. You also might want to extract "set.getOutput().substring(set.getOutput().lastIndexOf(")")+1)" into a function with a user-friendly name since you do this operation in many tests, I think to get the properties.
timeline.author: gjacoby126

timeline.bodyText: I'm curious why we're qualifying the CF properties in one flat HashSet instead of a HashSet<String, HashSet<String, String>>? Can we guarantee that no CF properties will ever have a period in them?
timeline.author: gjacoby126

replies.bodyText:
@gjacoby126 We are trying to find common CF property so that we don't need to specify it for every column family in the output string. Are you suggesting that we could use hashmap instead?
Update: I reviewed the grammar of the column family name and we use underscore as the separator between words.
replies.author: Qinrui98

timeline.bodyText: Good catch for salted tables, those are easy to miss.
timeline.author: gjacoby126

timeline.bodyText: I feel this and testCreateTableWithNonDefaultColumnFamily can be clubbed into one test?
timeline.author: swaroopak

timeline.bodyText: even this can be clubbed with above one as there is only one extra property here.
timeline.author: swaroopak
